`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-prisma",children:`// prisma/schema.prisma
generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model User {
  id          String   @id @default(cuid())
  email       String   @unique
  name        String?
  avatar      String?
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
  
  // Subscription fields
  subscription   Subscription?
  stripeCustomerId String? @unique
  
  // Relations
  projects    Project[]
  apiKeys     ApiKey[]
  
  @@map("users")
}

model Subscription {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  userId            String   @unique
  status            String
  priceId           String
  currentPeriodEnd  DateTime
  cancelAtPeriodEnd Boolean  @default(false)
  createdAt         DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt         DateTime @updatedAt
  
  user User @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
  
  @@map("subscriptions")
}

model Project {
  id          String   @id @default(cuid())
  name        String
  description String?
  userId      String
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
  
  user User @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
  
  @@map("projects")
}

model ApiKey {
  id        String   @id @default(cuid())
  name      String
  key       String   @unique
  userId    String
  lastUsed  DateTime?
  createdAt DateTime @default(now())
  
  user User @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
  
  @@map("api_keys")
}

import { clerkMiddleware, createRouteMatcher } from '@clerk/nextjs/server'

const isProtectedRoute = createRouteMatcher([
  '/dashboard(.*)',
  '/api/protected(.*)'
])

export default clerkMiddleware((auth, req) => {
  if (isProtectedRoute(req)) auth().protect()
})

export const config = {
  matcher: ['/((?!.*\\\\..*|_next).*)', '/', '/(api|trpc)(.*)'],
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// src/app/api/projects/route.ts
import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server'
import { auth } from '@clerk/nextjs/server'
import { db } from '@/lib/db'
import { z } from 'zod'

const createProjectSchema = z.object({
  name: z.string().min(1).max(100),
  description: z.string().optional(),
})

export async function GET() {
  try {
    const { userId } = auth()
    
    if (!userId) {
      return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 })
    }

    const projects = await db.project.findMany({
      where: { userId },
      orderBy: { createdAt: 'desc' },
    })

    return NextResponse.json({ projects })
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error fetching projects:', error)
    return NextResponse.json(
      { error: 'Internal server error' },
      { status: 500 }
    )
  }
}

export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
  try {
    const { userId } = auth()
    
    if (!userId) {
      return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 })
    }

    const body = await request.json()
    const validatedData = createProjectSchema.parse(body)

    const project = await db.project.create({
      data: {
        ...validatedData,
        userId,
      },
    })

    return NextResponse.json({ project }, { status: 201 })
  } catch (error) {
    if (error instanceof z.ZodError) {
      return NextResponse.json(
        { error: 'Invalid input', details: error.errors },
        { status: 400 }
      )
    }

    console.error('Error creating project:', error)
    return NextResponse.json(
      { error: 'Internal server error' },
      { status: 500 }
    )
  }
}

'use client'

import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'
import { Project } from '@prisma/client'

interface ProjectListProps {
  initialProjects: Project[]
}

export function ProjectList({ initialProjects }: ProjectListProps) {
  const [projects, setProjects] = useState(initialProjects)
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)

  const createProject = async (data: { name: string; description?: string }) => {
    setLoading(true)
    try {
      const response = await fetch('/api/projects', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
        body: JSON.stringify(data),
      })

      if (!response.ok) {
        throw new Error('Failed to create project')
      }

      const { project } = await response.json()
      setProjects(prev => [project, ...prev])
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error creating project:', error)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="space-y-4">
      <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold">Projects</h2>
      
      <div className="grid gap-4">
        {projects.map(project => (
          <div key={project.id} className="p-4 border rounded-lg">
            <h3 className="font-semibold">{project.name}</h3>
            {project.description && (
              <p className="text-gray-600">{project.description}</p>
            )}
            <p className="text-sm text-gray-500">
              Created {new Date(project.createdAt).toLocaleDateString()}
            </p>
          </div>
        ))}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// src/lib/errors.ts
export class AppError extends Error {
  constructor(
    message: string,
    public statusCode: number = 500,
    public code?: string
  ) {
    super(message)
    this.name = 'AppError'
  }
}

export class ValidationError extends AppError {
  constructor(message: string, public errors: Record<string, string[]>) {
    super(message, 400, 'VALIDATION_ERROR')
    this.name = 'ValidationError'
  }
}

export class NotFoundError extends AppError {
  constructor(resource: string) {
    super(\`\${resource} not found\`, 404, 'NOT_FOUND')
    this.name = 'NotFoundError'
  }
}

// Error handler utility
export function handleApiError(error: unknown): Response {
  console.error('API Error:', error)

  if (error instanceof ValidationError) {
    return Response.json(
      { error: error.message, details: error.errors },
      { status: error.statusCode }
    )
  }

  if (error instanceof AppError) {
    return Response.json(
      { error: error.message, code: error.code },
      { status: error.statusCode }
    )
  }

  return Response.json(
    { error: 'Internal server error' },
    { status: 500 }
  )
}

import { db } from './db'

export async function getUserSubscription(userId: string) {
  const subscription = await db.subscription.findUnique({
    where: { userId },
  })

  return subscription
}

export async function isUserSubscribed(userId: string): Promise<boolean> {
  const subscription = await getUserSubscription(userId)
  
  if (!subscription) return false
  
  const now = new Date()
  return subscription.currentPeriodEnd > now && subscription.status === 'active'
}

export async function getUserLimits(userId: string) {
  const isSubscribed = await isUserSubscribed(userId)
  
  return {
    projects: isSubscribed ? 100 : 3,
    apiCalls: isSubscribed ? 100000 : 1000,
    storage: isSubscribed ? '10GB' : '100MB',
  }
}

import { GET, POST } from '@/app/api/projects/route'
import { db } from '@/lib/db'

// Mock Clerk auth
jest.mock('@clerk/nextjs/server', () => ({
  auth: () => ({ userId: 'test-user-id' }),
}))

describe('/api/projects', () => {
  beforeEach(async () => {
    // Clean up database
    await db.project.deleteMany()
  })

  describe('GET', () => {
    it('should return user projects', async () => {
      // Create test project
      await db.project.create({
        data: {
          name: 'Test Project',
          userId: 'test-user-id',
        },
      })

      const response = await GET()
      const data = await response.json()

      expect(response.status).toBe(200)
      expect(data.projects).toHaveLength(1)
      expect(data.projects[0].name).toBe('Test Project')
    })
  })

  describe('POST', () => {
    it('should create a new project', async () => {
      const request = new Request('http://localhost', {
        method: 'POST',
        body: JSON.stringify({
          name: 'New Project',
          description: 'Test description',
        }),
      })

      const response = await POST(request)
      const data = await response.json()

      expect(response.status).toBe(201)
      expect(data.project.name).toBe('New Project')
    })

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// AI-generated component example
const AIGeneratedButton = ({ variant = 'primary', size = 'md', children }) => {
  const baseClasses = 'px-4 py-2 rounded font-medium transition-colors'
  const variantClasses = {
    primary: 'bg-blue-600 text-white hover:bg-blue-700',
    secondary: 'bg-gray-200 text-gray-900 hover:bg-gray-300',
  }
  const sizeClasses = {
    sm: 'px-2 py-1 text-sm',
    md: 'px-4 py-2',
    lg: 'px-6 py-3 text-lg',
  }
  
  return (
    <button className={\`\${baseClasses} \${variantClasses[variant]} \${sizeClasses[size]}\`}>
      {children}
    </button>
  )
}
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d8066ff3-d10c-4c3d-b69b-f9b1bc6b155a.mdx",lineNumber:28,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d8066ff3-d10c-4c3d-b69b-f9b1bc6b155a.mdx",lineNumber:28,columnNumber:1},this),`

  })
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// Resource hints and preloading
const optimizedFetch = async (url: string) => {
  // Preload critical resources
  const link = document.createElement('link')
  link.rel = 'preload'
  link.href = url
  link.as = 'fetch'
  document.head.appendChild(link)
  
  return fetch(url)
}

// Image optimization
const OptimizedImage = ({ src, alt, ...props }) => (
  <Image
    src={src}
    alt={alt}
    loading="lazy"
    sizes="(max-width: 768px) 100vw, (max-width: 1200px) 50vw, 33vw"
    {...props}
  />
)
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d8066ff3-d10c-4c3d-b69b-f9b1bc6b155a.mdx",lineNumber:152,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-d8066ff3-d10c-4c3d-b69b-f9b1bc6b155a.mdx",lineNumber:152,columnNumber:1},this),`

const connectWallet = async () => {
  if (typeof window.ethereum !== 'undefined') {
    try {
      const accounts = await window.ethereum.request({
        method: 'eth_requestAccounts'
      })
      return accounts[0]
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Failed to connect wallet:', error)
    }
  }
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// Serverless function with edge optimization
export const config = {
  runtime: 'edge',
}

export default async function handler(req: Request) {
  const { searchParams } = new URL(req.url)
  const query = searchParams.get('q')
  
  // Process at the edge for minimal latency
  const results = await searchDatabase(query)
  
  return Response.json(results)
}

  )

    }
  })
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// lib/ai/openai-client.ts
import OpenAI from 'openai'
import { ContentTemplate, GenerationParams } from '@/types/content'

export class AIContentGenerator {
  private client: OpenAI

  constructor() {
    this.client = new OpenAI({
      apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY,
    })
  }

  async generateContent(params: GenerationParams): Promise<string> {
    const { template, topic, tone, length, keywords } = params

    const systemPrompt = this.buildSystemPrompt(template, tone)
    const userPrompt = this.buildUserPrompt(topic, length, keywords)

    try {
      const completion = await this.client.chat.completions.create({
        model: 'gpt-4-turbo-preview',
        messages: [
          { role: 'system', content: systemPrompt },
          { role: 'user', content: userPrompt }
        ],
        temperature: this.getTemperatureForTone(tone),
        max_tokens: this.getMaxTokensForLength(length),
        presence_penalty: 0.1,
        frequency_penalty: 0.1,
      })

      return completion.choices[0]?.message?.content || ''
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('AI generation error:', error)
      throw new AIGenerationError('Failed to generate content', error)
    }
  }

  private buildSystemPrompt(template: ContentTemplate, tone: string): string {
    return \`You are an expert content writer specializing in \${template.category}.
    
    Guidelines:
    - Write in a \${tone} tone
    - Follow the \${template.name} format
    - Ensure content is original and engaging
    - Include relevant examples and actionable insights
    - Optimize for readability and SEO when appropriate
    
    Template Structure:
    \${template.structure}
    
    Writing Style:
    \${this.getToneGuidelines(tone)}\`
  }

  private buildUserPrompt(topic: string, length: string, keywords: string[]): string {
    return \`Create content about: \${topic}
    
    Target length: \${length}
    \${keywords.length > 0 ? \`Include these keywords naturally: \${keywords.join(', ')}\` : ''}
    
    Focus on providing value to the reader while maintaining engagement throughout.\`
  }
}
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-06108dc8-672a-4129-a628-ace9faefffde.mdx",lineNumber:45,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-06108dc8-672a-4129-a628-ace9faefffde.mdx",lineNumber:45,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// lib/ai/fine-tuning.ts
import { OpenAI } from 'openai'
import { db } from '@/lib/db'

export class FineTuningManager {
  private client: OpenAI

  constructor() {
    this.client = new OpenAI({
      apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY,
    })
  }

  async prepareBrandTrainingData(brandId: string) {
    // Collect brand-specific content samples
    const brandContent = await db.brandContent.findMany({
      where: { brandId },
      include: { examples: true }
    })

    // Format for OpenAI fine-tuning
    const trainingData = brandContent.map(content => ({
      messages: [
        { role: 'system', content: this.getBrandSystemPrompt(brandId) },
        { role: 'user', content: content.prompt },
        { role: 'assistant', content: content.response }
      ]
    }))

    return this.formatForJSONL(trainingData)
  }

  async createFineTunedModel(brandId: string, trainingData: string) {
    try {
      // Upload training file
      const file = await this.client.files.create({
        file: new File([trainingData], 'training-data.jsonl'),
        purpose: 'fine-tune'
      })

      // Create fine-tuning job
      const fineTune = await this.client.fineTuning.jobs.create({
        training_file: file.id,
        model: 'gpt-3.5-turbo',
        hyperparameters: {
          n_epochs: 3,
          batch_size: 4,
          learning_rate_multiplier: 0.1
        }
      })

      // Store job info in database
      await db.fineTuneJob.create({
        data: {
          brandId,
          jobId: fineTune.id,
          status: 'pending',
          fileId: file.id
        }
      })

      return fineTune
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Fine-tuning error:', error)
      throw error
    }
  }
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// lib/content/template-engine.ts
interface ContentTemplate {
  id: string
  name: string
  category: string
  structure: TemplateSection[]
  variables: TemplateVariable[]
}

interface TemplateSection {
  name: string
  required: boolean
  description: string
  examples: string[]
}

export class TemplateEngine {
  private templates: Map<string, ContentTemplate> = new Map()

  constructor() {
    this.loadTemplates()
  }

  async generateFromTemplate(
    templateId: string, 
    variables: Record<string, any>
  ): Promise<string> {
    const template = this.templates.get(templateId)
    if (!template) {
      throw new Error(\`Template \${templateId} not found\`)
    }

    // Validate required variables
    this.validateVariables(template, variables)

    // Build content using template structure
    let content = ''
    for (const section of template.structure) {
      const sectionContent = await this.generateSection(section, variables)
      content += sectionContent + '\\n\\n'
    }

    return content.trim()
  }

  private async generateSection(
    section: TemplateSection, 
    variables: Record<string, any>
  ): Promise<string> {
    const prompt = \`Generate a \${section.name} section for content about \${variables.topic}.
    
    Section Description: \${section.description}
    
    Examples of good \${section.name} sections:
    \${section.examples.join('\\n---\\n')}
    
    Variables available:
    \${Object.entries(variables).map(([key, value]) => \`\${key}: \${value}\`).join('\\n')}
    
    Generate the section content:\`

    const aiClient = new AIContentGenerator()
    return await aiClient.generateContent({
      template: { structure: prompt },
      topic: variables.topic,
      tone: variables.tone || 'professional',
      length: 'medium'
    })
  }
}

import { AIContentGenerator } from '@/lib/ai/openai-client'

export class ContentEnhancer {
  private aiClient: AIContentGenerator

  constructor() {
    this.aiClient = new AIContentGenerator()
  }

  async optimizeForSEO(content: string, targetKeywords: string[]): Promise<string> {
    const prompt = \`Optimize the following content for SEO while maintaining natural readability:

    Target Keywords: \${targetKeywords.join(', ')}
    
    Original Content:
    \${content}
    
    Requirements:
    - Include target keywords naturally (avoid keyword stuffing)
    - Improve meta description potential
    - Add semantic keywords and variations
    - Maintain original tone and message
    - Ensure content flows naturally
    
    Return the optimized content:\`

    return await this.aiClient.generateContent({
      template: { structure: prompt },
      topic: 'SEO optimization',
      tone: 'professional',
      length: 'maintain'
    })
  }

  async improveReadability(content: string): Promise<{
    improvedContent: string
    readabilityScore: number
    suggestions: string[]
  }> {
    // Analyze current readability
    const currentScore = this.calculateReadabilityScore(content)
    
    if (currentScore >= 70) {
      return { 
        improvedContent: content, 
        readabilityScore: currentScore,
        suggestions: []
      }
    }

    const prompt = \`Improve the readability of this content while preserving its meaning:

    Current Content:
    \${content}
    
    Improvements needed:
    - Simplify complex sentences
    - Use shorter paragraphs
    - Replace jargon with simpler terms
    - Improve flow between ideas
    - Make it more scannable
    
    Return the improved version:\`

    const improvedContent = await this.aiClient.generateContent({
      template: { structure: prompt },
      topic: 'content improvement',
      tone: 'clear and accessible',
      length: 'maintain'
    })

    const newScore = this.calculateReadabilityScore(improvedContent)
    const suggestions = this.generateSuggestions(content, improvedContent)

    return {
      improvedContent,
      readabilityScore: newScore,
      suggestions
    }
  }

  private calculateReadabilityScore(content: string): number {
    // Implement Flesch Reading Ease or similar algorithm
    const sentences = content.split(/[.!?]+/).length
    const words = content.split(/\\s+/).length
    const syllables = this.countSyllables(content)

    const avgSentenceLength = words / sentences
    const avgSyllablesPerWord = syllables / words

    // Flesch Reading Ease formula
    const score = 206.835 - (1.015 * avgSentenceLength) - (84.6 * avgSyllablesPerWord)
    return Math.max(0, Math.min(100, score))
  }
}

import { useState } from 'react'
import { ContentTemplate, GenerationParams } from '@/types/content'

interface GenerationWorkflowProps {
  templates: ContentTemplate[]
  onGenerate: (params: GenerationParams) => Promise<string>
}

export const GenerationWorkflow: React.FC<GenerationWorkflowProps> = ({
  templates,
  onGenerate
}) => {
  const [currentStep, setCurrentStep] = useState(1)
  const [params, setParams] = useState<Partial<GenerationParams>>({})
  const [isGenerating, setIsGenerating] = useState(false)
  const [generatedContent, setGeneratedContent] = useState('')

  const steps = [
    { id: 1, name: 'Template', component: TemplateSelector },
    { id: 2, name: 'Parameters', component: ParametersForm },
    { id: 3, name: 'Generate', component: GenerationStep },
    { id: 4, name: 'Review', component: ContentReview }
  ]

  const handleGenerate = async () => {
    setIsGenerating(true)
    try {
      const content = await onGenerate(params as GenerationParams)
      setGeneratedContent(content)
      setCurrentStep(4)
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Generation failed:', error)
    } finally {
      setIsGenerating(false)
    }
  }

  const CurrentStepComponent = steps.find(s => s.id === currentStep)?.component

  return (
    <div className="max-w-4xl mx-auto">
      {/* Progress Indicator */}
      <div className="mb-8">
        <div className="flex items-center justify-between">
          {steps.map((step, index) => (
            <div key={step.id} className="flex items-center">
              <div className={\`
                w-8 h-8 rounded-full flex items-center justify-center text-sm font-medium
                \${currentStep >= step.id 
                  ? 'bg-blue-600 text-white' 
                  : 'bg-gray-200 text-gray-600'
                }
              \`}>
                {step.id}
              </div>
              <span className="ml-2 text-sm font-medium text-gray-900">
                {step.name}
              </span>
              {index < steps.length - 1 && (
                <div className={\`
                  w-16 h-0.5 mx-4
                  \${currentStep > step.id ? 'bg-blue-600' : 'bg-gray-200'}
                \`} />
              )}
            </div>
          ))}
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Step Content */}
      <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow p-6">
        {CurrentStepComponent && (
          <CurrentStepComponent
            params={params}
            onParamsChange={setParams}
            templates={templates}
            isGenerating={isGenerating}
            generatedContent={generatedContent}
            onGenerate={handleGenerate}
            onNext={() => setCurrentStep(prev => prev + 1)}
            onPrevious={() => setCurrentStep(prev => prev - 1)}
          />
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
import { debounce } from 'lodash'

interface LivePreviewProps {
  content: string
  onContentChange: (content: string) => void
  readOnly?: boolean
}

export const LivePreview: React.FC<LivePreviewProps> = ({
  content,
  onContentChange,
  readOnly = false
}) => {
  const [previewMode, setPreviewMode] = useState<'edit' | 'preview'>('edit')
  const [wordCount, setWordCount] = useState(0)
  const [readingTime, setReadingTime] = useState(0)

  const debouncedUpdate = debounce((newContent: string) => {
    onContentChange(newContent)
    updateMetrics(newContent)
  }, 300)

  const updateMetrics = (text: string) => {
    const words = text.trim().split(/\\s+/).length
    setWordCount(words)
    setReadingTime(Math.ceil(words / 200)) // 200 words per minute
  }

  useEffect(() => {
    updateMetrics(content)
  }, [content])

  return (
    <div className="border border-gray-200 rounded-lg overflow-hidden">
      {/* Toolbar */}
      <div className="bg-gray-50 px-4 py-2 border-b border-gray-200 flex items-center justify-between">
        <div className="flex items-center space-x-4">
          <div className="flex bg-white rounded-md">
            <button
              className={\`px-3 py-1 text-sm font-medium rounded-l-md \${
                previewMode === 'edit' 
                  ? 'bg-blue-100 text-blue-700' 
                  : 'text-gray-500 hover:text-gray-700'
              }\`}
              onClick={() => setPreviewMode('edit')}
            >
              Edit
            </button>
            <button
              className={\`px-3 py-1 text-sm font-medium rounded-r-md \${
                previewMode === 'preview' 
                  ? 'bg-blue-100 text-blue-700' 
                  : 'text-gray-500 hover:text-gray-700'
              }\`}
              onClick={() => setPreviewMode('preview')}
            >
              Preview
            </button>
          </div>
        </div>
        
        <div className="flex items-center space-x-4 text-sm text-gray-500">
          <span>{wordCount} words</span>
          <span>{readingTime} min read</span>
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Content Area */}
      <div className="h-96">
        {previewMode === 'edit' ? (
          <textarea
            className="w-full h-full p-4 border-none resize-none focus:outline-none font-mono text-sm"
            value={content}
            onChange={(e) => debouncedUpdate(e.target.value)}
            readOnly={readOnly}
            placeholder="Your generated content will appear here..."
          />
        ) : (
          <div className="h-full p-4 overflow-auto prose prose-sm max-w-none">
            <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: formatContent(content) }} />
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

function formatContent(content: string): string {
  // Convert markdown-like formatting to HTML
  return content
    .replace(/\\*\\*(.*?)\\*\\*/g, '<strong>$1</strong>')
    .replace(/\\*(.*?)\\*/g, '<em>$1</em>')
    .replace(/\\n\\n/g, '</p><p>')
    .replace(/\\n/g, '<br>')
    .replace(/^/, '<p>')
    .replace(/$/, '</p>')
}

export class BatchContentGenerator {
  private queue: GenerationJob[] = []
  private processing = false

  async addBatchJob(job: BatchGenerationJob): Promise<string> {
    const jobId = generateId()
    
    await db.batchJob.create({
      data: {
        id: jobId,
        userId: job.userId,
        status: 'pending',
        totalItems: job.items.length,
        completedItems: 0,
        parameters: JSON.stringify(job.params)
      }
    })

    // Add individual items to queue
    job.items.forEach(item => {
      this.queue.push({
        jobId,
        itemId: item.id,
        params: { ...job.params, ...item.overrides }
      })
    })

    this.processQueue()
    return jobId
  }

  private async processQueue() {
    if (this.processing || this.queue.length === 0) return
    
    this.processing = true
    
    while (this.queue.length > 0) {
      const job = this.queue.shift()!
      
      try {
        const content = await this.generateSingleContent(job.params)
        
        await db.generatedContent.create({
          data: {
            jobId: job.jobId,
            itemId: job.itemId,
            content,
            status: 'completed'
          }
        })

        // Update job progress
        await this.updateJobProgress(job.jobId)
        
      } catch (error) {
        console.error('Batch generation error:', error)
        await this.handleJobError(job.jobId, job.itemId, error)
      }
    }
    
    this.processing = false
  }
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// lib/analytics/content-analytics.ts
export class ContentAnalytics {
  async trackGeneration(userId: string, params: GenerationParams) {
    await db.generationEvent.create({
      data: {
        userId,
        templateId: params.template.id,
        contentType: params.template.category,
        wordCount: this.estimateWordCount(params),
        timestamp: new Date()
      }
    })
  }

  async getUsageStats(userId: string, timeRange: string) {
    const startDate = this.getStartDate(timeRange)
    
    const stats = await db.generationEvent.groupBy({
      by: ['contentType'],
      where: {
        userId,
        timestamp: { gte: startDate }
      },
      _count: { id: true },
      _sum: { wordCount: true }
    })

    return {
      totalGenerations: stats.reduce((sum, stat) => sum + stat._count.id, 0),
      totalWords: stats.reduce((sum, stat) => sum + (stat._sum.wordCount || 0), 0),
      byType: stats.map(stat => ({
        type: stat.contentType,
        count: stat._count.id,
        words: stat._sum.wordCount || 0
      }))
    }
  }

  async getPopularTemplates(timeRange: string) {
    const startDate = this.getStartDate(timeRange)
    
    return await db.generationEvent.groupBy({
      by: ['templateId'],
      where: {
        timestamp: { gte: startDate }
      },
      _count: { id: true },
      orderBy: { _count: { id: 'desc' } },
      take: 10
    })
  }
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// lib/rate-limiting/ai-usage.ts
import { Ratelimit } from '@upstash/ratelimit'
import { Redis } from '@upstash/redis'

const redis = new Redis({
  url: process.env.UPSTASH_REDIS_REST_URL!,
  token: process.env.UPSTASH_REDIS_REST_TOKEN!,
})

export const aiRateLimit = new Ratelimit({
  redis,
  limiter: Ratelimit.slidingWindow(10, '1 m'), // 10 requests per minute
  analytics: true,
})

export const premiumAiRateLimit = new Ratelimit({
  redis,
  limiter: Ratelimit.slidingWindow(100, '1 m'), // 100 requests per minute for premium
  analytics: true,
})

export async function checkAIUsage(userId: string, isPremium: boolean = false) {
  const rateLimit = isPremium ? premiumAiRateLimit : aiRateLimit
  const { success, limit, reset, remaining } = await rateLimit.limit(userId)
  
  return {
    allowed: success,
    limit,
    remaining,
    resetTime: new Date(reset)
  }
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// lib/cache/content-cache.ts
export class ContentCache {
  private redis: Redis

  constructor() {
    this.redis = new Redis(process.env.REDIS_URL!)
  }

  private getCacheKey(params: GenerationParams): string {
    const key = {
      template: params.template.id,
      topic: params.topic,
      tone: params.tone,
      length: params.length,
      keywords: params.keywords?.sort()
    }
    return \`content:\${hashObject(key)}\`
  }

  async get(params: GenerationParams): Promise<string | null> {
    const key = this.getCacheKey(params)
    return await this.redis.get(key)
  }

  async set(params: GenerationParams, content: string, ttl: number = 3600) {
    const key = this.getCacheKey(params)
    await this.redis.setex(key, ttl, content)
  }

  async invalidatePattern(pattern: string) {
    const keys = await this.redis.keys(pattern)
    if (keys.length > 0) {
      await this.redis.del(...keys)
    }
  }
}

document.title: Drew Hub - Modern SaaS Platform
document.description: A comprehensive SaaS platform built with Next.js 14, featuring blog engine, CMS dashboard, authentication, and modern UI components.

body.raw:
# Drew Hub - Modern SaaS Platform Drew Hub is a comprehensive, production-ready SaaS platform that demonstrates modern web development best practices. Built with Next.js 14 and TypeScript, it features a complete blog engine, CMS dashboard, authentication system, and custom UI components. ## Features ### 🚀 Core Technology Stack - **Next.js 14** with App Router and Server Components - **TypeScript** for type safety throughout the application - **Tailwind CSS** with custom design system - **Prisma** for type-safe database operations - **Clerk** for authentication and user management - **PlanetScale** for serverless MySQL database ### 📝 Blog Engine - **MDX Support** for rich content authoring - **Contentlayer** for content management - **Algolia Search** integration for fast content discovery - **RSS/Atom Feeds** for content syndication - **Dynamic Sitemap** generation for SEO - **Tag-based Organization** with filtering capabilities ### 🎛️ CMS Dashboard - **Admin Interface** for content management - **Analytics Dashboard** with key performance indicators - **CRUD Operations** for posts and projects - **Drag-and-Drop** project reordering - **User Management** and settings configuration - **Newsletter Management** with subscriber analytics ### 🎨 Modern UI/UX - **Custom Design System** built on Tailwind CSS - **shadcn/ui Components** for consistent interface elements - **Responsive Design** optimized for all devices - **Dark Mode** support with system preference detection - **Accessibility** compliant with WCAG guidelines - **Performance Optimized** with Core Web Vitals focus ### 🔒 Security & Authentication - **Clerk Integration** for secure user authentication - **Role-based Access Control** for different user types - **API Route Protection** with middleware - **CSRF Protection** and security headers - **Content Security Policy** implementation ## Technical Implementation ### Architecture Decisions #### App Router Implementation ```typescript // app/blog/[slug]/page.tsx import { notFound } from 'next/navigation' import { allPosts } from 'contentlayer/generated' import { MDXContent } from '@/components/mdx/mdx-content' export async function generateStaticParams() { return allPosts.map((post) => ({ slug: post.slug, })) } export default function BlogPost({ params }: { params: { slug: string } }) { const post = allPosts.find((post) => post.slug === params.slug) if (!post) { notFound() } return (

{post.title}

{post.description}

) } ``` #### Database Schema Design ```prisma model Post { id String @id @default(cuid()) title String slug String @unique description String content String @db.Text published Boolean @default(false) featured Boolean @default(false) createdAt DateTime @default(now()) updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt // Relations author User @relation(fields: [authorId], references: [id]) authorId String tags PostTag[] @@map("posts") } ``` #### API Route Implementation ```typescript // app/api/posts/route.ts import { NextRequest } from 'next/server' import { auth } from '@clerk/nextjs/server' import { db } from '@/lib/db' import { createPostSchema } from '@/lib/validations/post' export async function POST(request: NextRequest) { try { const { userId } = auth() if (!userId) { return Response.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 }) } const body = await request.json() const validatedData = createPostSchema.parse(body) const post = await db.post.create({ data: { ...validatedData, authorId: userId, slug: slugify(validatedData.title), }, }) return Response.json({ post }, { status: 201 }) } catch (error) { return handleApiError(error) } } ``` ### Performance Optimizations #### Image Optimization - **Next.js Image Component** for automatic optimization - **WebP/AVIF** format support with fallbacks - **Lazy Loading** with intersection observer - **Responsive Images** with appropriate sizing #### Caching Strategy ```typescript // lib/cache.ts import { unstable_cache } from 'next/cache' export const getCachedPosts = unstable_cache( async () => { return await db.post.findMany({ where: { published: true }, orderBy: { createdAt: 'desc' }, include: { author: true, tags: true }, }) }, ['posts'], { revalidate: 3600 } // 1 hour ) ``` #### Bundle Optimization - **Dynamic Imports** for code splitting - **Tree Shaking** to eliminate unused code - **Compression** with gzip/brotli - **CDN Integration** for static assets ## Development Workflow ### Code Quality - **ESLint** with strict TypeScript rules - **Prettier** for consistent code formatting - **Husky** for pre-commit hooks - **Conventional Commits** for better git history ### Testing Strategy ```typescript // __tests__/components/blog-post.test.tsx import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react' import { BlogPost } from '@/components/blog/blog-post' const mockPost = { id: '1', title: 'Test Post', description: 'Test description', content: 'Test content', createdAt: new Date(), } describe('BlogPost', () => { it('renders post title and content', () => { render() expect(screen.getByText('Test Post')).toBeInTheDocument() expect(screen.getByText('Test description')).toBeInTheDocument() }) }) ``` ### CI/CD Pipeline ```yaml # .github/workflows/ci-cd.yml name: CI/CD Pipeline on: push: branches: [main] pull_request: branches: [main] jobs: test: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 - uses: actions/setup-node@v4 with: node-version: '18' cache: 'npm' - run: npm ci - run: npm run lint - run: npm run type-check - run: npm run test - run: npm run build ``` ## Deployment & Infrastructure ### Vercel Deployment - **Edge Functions** for optimal performance - **Analytics** integration for monitoring - **Environment Variables** management - **Preview Deployments** for pull requests ### Database Strategy - **PlanetScale** for serverless MySQL - **Branch-based Development** for schema changes - **Connection Pooling** for optimal performance - **Backup and Recovery** procedures ### Monitoring & Analytics - **Vercel Analytics** for performance metrics - **Error Tracking** with Sentry integration - **User Analytics** with privacy-focused solutions - **Core Web Vitals** monitoring ## Learning Outcomes This project demonstrates proficiency in: 1. **Modern React Patterns** - Server Components, Suspense, Error Boundaries 2. **Full-Stack Development** - API design, database modeling, authentication 3. **Performance Optimization** - Caching strategies, image optimization, Core Web Vitals 4. **DevOps Practices** - CI/CD pipelines, testing strategies, deployment automation 5. **User Experience** - Responsive design, accessibility, progressive enhancement ## Future Enhancements ### Planned Features - [ ] **Multi-tenant Architecture** for SaaS scaling - [ ] **Advanced Analytics** with custom dashboards - [ ] **Email Marketing** integration - [ ] **Payment Processing** with Stripe - [ ] **API Rate Limiting** and usage analytics - [ ] **Content Localization** for international users ### Technical Improvements - [ ] **Edge Computing** optimization - [ ] **Database Sharding** for scalability - [ ] **Real-time Features** with WebSockets - [ ] **Progressive Web App** capabilities - [ ] **Advanced Caching** with Redis - [ ] **Microservices** architecture migration ## Repository Structure ``` drew-hub/ ├── .github/workflows/ # CI/CD pipelines ├── app/ # Next.js app directory ├── components/ # Reusable React components ├── content/ # MDX content files ├── lib/ # Utility functions and configurations ├── prisma/ # Database schema and migrations ├── public/ # Static assets ├── styles/ # Global styles and Tailwind config └── types/ # TypeScript type definitions ``` This project serves as a comprehensive example of modern web development practices, demonstrating how to build scalable, maintainable, and performant web applications using the latest technologies and best practices.

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// app/blog/[slug]/page.tsx
import { notFound } from 'next/navigation'
import { allPosts } from 'contentlayer/generated'
import { MDXContent } from '@/components/mdx/mdx-content'

export async function generateStaticParams() {
  return allPosts.map((post) => ({
    slug: post.slug,
  }))
}

export default function BlogPost({ params }: { params: { slug: string } }) {
  const post = allPosts.find((post) => post.slug === params.slug)
  
  if (!post) {
    notFound()
  }

  return (
    <article className="prose prose-lg max-w-4xl mx-auto">
      <header className="mb-8">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold">{post.title}</h1>
        <p className="text-xl text-gray-600 mt-4">{post.description}</p>
      </header>
      <MDXContent code={post.body.code} />
    </article>
  )
}
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-73164f05-927c-485d-844d-d39721c78147.mdx",lineNumber:62,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-73164f05-927c-485d-844d-d39721c78147.mdx",lineNumber:62,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-prisma",children:`model Post {
  id          String   @id @default(cuid())
  title       String
  slug        String   @unique
  description String
  content     String   @db.Text
  published   Boolean  @default(false)
  featured    Boolean  @default(false)
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
  
  // Relations
  author   User   @relation(fields: [authorId], references: [id])
  authorId String
  tags     PostTag[]
  
  @@map("posts")
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// app/api/posts/route.ts
import { NextRequest } from 'next/server'
import { auth } from '@clerk/nextjs/server'
import { db } from '@/lib/db'
import { createPostSchema } from '@/lib/validations/post'

export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
  try {
    const { userId } = auth()
    if (!userId) {
      return Response.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 })
    }

    const body = await request.json()
    const validatedData = createPostSchema.parse(body)

    const post = await db.post.create({
      data: {
        ...validatedData,
        authorId: userId,
        slug: slugify(validatedData.title),
      },
    })

    return Response.json({ post }, { status: 201 })
  } catch (error) {
    return handleApiError(error)
  }
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// lib/cache.ts
import { unstable_cache } from 'next/cache'

export const getCachedPosts = unstable_cache(
  async () => {
    return await db.post.findMany({
      where: { published: true },
      orderBy: { createdAt: 'desc' },
      include: { author: true, tags: true },
    })
  },
  ['posts'],
  { revalidate: 3600 } // 1 hour
)

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// __tests__/components/blog-post.test.tsx
import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react'
import { BlogPost } from '@/components/blog/blog-post'

const mockPost = {
  id: '1',
  title: 'Test Post',
  description: 'Test description',
  content: 'Test content',
  createdAt: new Date(),
}

describe('BlogPost', () => {
  it('renders post title and content', () => {
    render(<BlogPost post={mockPost} />)
    
    expect(screen.getByText('Test Post')).toBeInTheDocument()
    expect(screen.getByText('Test description')).toBeInTheDocument()
  })
})

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-yaml",children:`# .github/workflows/ci-cd.yml
name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '18'
          cache: 'npm'
      
      - run: npm ci
      - run: npm run lint
      - run: npm run type-check
      - run: npm run test
      - run: npm run build
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-73164f05-927c-485d-844d-d39721c78147.mdx",lineNumber:213,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-73164f05-927c-485d-844d-d39721c78147.mdx",lineNumber:213,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// components/Dashboard/DashboardLayout.tsx
interface DashboardLayoutProps {
  children: React.ReactNode
  sidebar?: React.ReactNode
  header?: React.ReactNode
}

export const DashboardLayout: React.FC<DashboardLayoutProps> = ({
  children,
  sidebar,
  header
}) => {
  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-50">
      {header && (
        <header className="bg-white shadow-sm border-b">
          {header}
        </header>
      )}
      <div className="flex">
        {sidebar && (
          <aside className="w-64 bg-white shadow-sm">
            {sidebar}
          </aside>
        )}
        <main className="flex-1 p-6">
          {children}
        </main>
      </div>
    </div>
  )

import { Line } from 'react-chartjs-2'
import { useSalesData } from '@/hooks/useSalesData'

interface SalesChartProps {
  timeRange: 'daily' | 'weekly' | 'monthly'
  productId?: string
}

export const SalesChart: React.FC<SalesChartProps> = ({ 
  timeRange, 
  productId 
}) => {
  const { data, loading, error } = useSalesData({ timeRange, productId })

  const chartOptions = {
    responsive: true,
    plugins: {
      legend: {
        position: 'top' as const,
      },
      title: {
        display: true,
        text: \`Sales Performance - \${timeRange}\`,
      },
    },
    scales: {
      y: {
        beginAtZero: true,
        ticks: {
          callback: function(value: any) {
            return '$' + value.toLocaleString()
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }

  if (loading) return <ChartSkeleton />
  if (error) return <ErrorMessage error={error} />

  return (
    <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-lg shadow">
      <Line data={data} options={chartOptions} />
    </div>
  )
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// api/analytics/sales.ts
import { NextApiRequest, NextApiResponse } from 'next'
import { db } from '@/lib/database'
import { authenticateUser } from '@/lib/auth'
import { calculateSalesMetrics } from '@/lib/analytics'

export default async function handler(
  req: NextApiRequest,
  res: NextApiResponse
) {
  try {
    const user = await authenticateUser(req)
    if (!user) {
      return res.status(401).json({ error: 'Unauthorized' })
    }

    const { timeRange, startDate, endDate, productId } = req.query

    const rawData = await db.order.findMany({
      where: {
        storeId: user.storeId,
        createdAt: {
          gte: new Date(startDate as string),
          lte: new Date(endDate as string),
        },
        ...(productId && { 
          items: { 
            some: { productId: productId as string } 
          } 
        }),
      },
      include: {
        items: {
          include: {
            product: true,
          },
        },
        customer: true,
      },
    })

    const analytics = calculateSalesMetrics(rawData, timeRange as string)

    res.status(200).json({
      success: true,
      data: analytics,
      meta: {
        totalOrders: rawData.length,
        timeRange,
        generatedAt: new Date().toISOString(),
      },
    })
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Sales analytics error:', error)
    res.status(500).json({ 
      error: 'Failed to fetch sales analytics',
      details: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' ? error.message : undefined
    })
  }
}
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-f42f8a3a-dab9-4a25-b846-73b1671c998d.mdx",lineNumber:140,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-f42f8a3a-dab9-4a25-b846-73b1671c998d.mdx",lineNumber:140,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// lib/websocket/analytics.ts
import { Server as SocketIOServer } from 'socket.io'
import { authenticateSocket } from './auth'

export const setupAnalyticsSocket = (io: SocketIOServer) => {
  const analyticsNamespace = io.of('/analytics')

  analyticsNamespace.use(authenticateSocket)

  analyticsNamespace.on('connection', (socket) => {
    console.log(\`Analytics client connected: \${socket.id}\`)

    socket.on('subscribe-to-sales', (storeId: string) => {
      socket.join(\`sales:\${storeId}\`)
      
      // Send initial data
      getSalesData(storeId).then(data => {
        socket.emit('sales-update', data)
      })
    })

    socket.on('disconnect', () => {
      console.log(\`Analytics client disconnected: \${socket.id}\`)
    })
  })

  // Emit updates when new orders come in
  const emitSalesUpdate = (storeId: string, orderData: any) => {
    analyticsNamespace.to(\`sales:\${storeId}\`).emit('sales-update', {
      type: 'new-order',
      data: orderData,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
    })
  }

  return { emitSalesUpdate }
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-sql",children:`-- Optimized query for sales analytics
WITH daily_sales AS (
  SELECT 
    DATE(created_at) as sale_date,
    SUM(total_amount) as daily_revenue,
    COUNT(*) as daily_orders,
    COUNT(DISTINCT customer_id) as unique_customers
  FROM orders 
  WHERE 
    store_id = $1 
    AND created_at >= $2 
    AND created_at <= $3
    AND status = 'completed'
  GROUP BY DATE(created_at)
),
product_performance AS (
  SELECT 
    p.id,
    p.name,
    SUM(oi.quantity) as units_sold,
    SUM(oi.quantity * oi.price) as revenue
  FROM products p
  JOIN order_items oi ON p.id = oi.product_id
  JOIN orders o ON oi.order_id = o.id
  WHERE 
    o.store_id = $1 
    AND o.created_at >= $2 
    AND o.created_at <= $3
    AND o.status = 'completed'
  GROUP BY p.id, p.name
  ORDER BY revenue DESC
  LIMIT 10
)
SELECT * FROM daily_sales, product_performance;
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-f42f8a3a-dab9-4a25-b846-73b1671c998d.mdx",lineNumber:247,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-f42f8a3a-dab9-4a25-b846-73b1671c998d.mdx",lineNumber:247,columnNumber:1},this),`

  field: string

  groupBy?: string

export const MetricsBuilder: React.FC = () => {
  const [metrics, setMetrics] = useState<MetricConfig[]>([])
  const [isBuilding, setIsBuilding] = useState(false)

  const addMetric = (config: MetricConfig) => {
    setMetrics(prev => [...prev, { ...config, id: generateId() }])
  }

  const calculateCustomMetric = async (config: MetricConfig) => {
    const response = await fetch('/api/analytics/custom', {
      method: 'POST',

      <h3 className="text-lg font-semibold mb-4">Custom Metrics Builder</h3>

    </div>
  )
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// lib/analytics/predictions.ts
import * as tf from '@tensorflow/tfjs'

export class SalesPredictor {
  private model: tf.LayersModel | null = null

  async loadModel() {
    this.model = await tf.loadLayersModel('/models/sales-prediction/model.json')
  }

  async predictSales(historicalData: number[], daysAhead: number = 7) {
    if (!this.model) {
      await this.loadModel()
    }

    // Normalize data
    const normalized = this.normalizeData(historicalData)
    
    // Create tensor
    const inputTensor = tf.tensor2d([normalized], [1, normalized.length])
    
    // Make prediction
    const prediction = this.model!.predict(inputTensor) as tf.Tensor
    const result = await prediction.data()
    
    // Denormalize and return
    return this.denormalizeData(Array.from(result))
  }

  private normalizeData(data: number[]) {
    const max = Math.max(...data)
    const min = Math.min(...data)
    return data.map(val => (val - min) / (max - min))
  }

  private denormalizeData(data: number[]) {
    // Implementation depends on normalization strategy
    return data
  }
}
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-f42f8a3a-dab9-4a25-b846-73b1671c998d.mdx",lineNumber:345,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-f42f8a3a-dab9-4a25-b846-73b1671c998d.mdx",lineNumber:345,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// lib/cache/analytics.ts
import Redis from 'ioredis'

const redis = new Redis(process.env.REDIS_URL)

export class AnalyticsCache {
  private generateKey(storeId: string, params: any) {
    return \`analytics:\${storeId}:\${JSON.stringify(params)}\`
  }

  async get(storeId: string, params: any) {
    const key = this.generateKey(storeId, params)
    const cached = await redis.get(key)
    return cached ? JSON.parse(cached) : null
  }

  async set(storeId: string, params: any, data: any, ttl: number = 300) {
    const key = this.generateKey(storeId, params)
    await redis.setex(key, ttl, JSON.stringify(data))
  }

  async invalidate(storeId: string) {
    const pattern = \`analytics:\${storeId}:*\`
    const keys = await redis.keys(pattern)
    if (keys.length > 0) {
      await redis.del(...keys)
    }
  }
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-typescript",children:`// components/DataTable/VirtualizedTable.tsx
import { FixedSizeList as List } from 'react-window'

interface VirtualizedTableProps {
  data: any[]
  columns: ColumnConfig[]
  height: number
}

export const VirtualizedTable: React.FC<VirtualizedTableProps> = ({
  data,
  columns,
  height
}) => {
  const Row = ({ index, style }: { index: number; style: any }) => (
    <div style={style} className="flex items-center border-b">
      {columns.map(column => (
        <div key={column.key} className={\`flex-1 px-4 py-2 \${column.className}\`}>
          {column.render ? column.render(data[index]) : data[index][column.key]}
        </div>
      ))}
    </div>
  )

  return (
    <List
      height={height}
      itemCount={data.length}
      itemSize={50}
      className="border border-gray-200 rounded"
    >
      {Row}
    </List>
  )
}

import { render, screen, waitFor } from '@testing-library/react'
import { SalesChart } from '@/components/Charts/SalesChart'
import { mockSalesData } from '@/test/mocks'

jest.mock('@/hooks/useSalesData')

describe('SalesChart', () => {
  it('renders chart with sales data', async () => {
    const mockUseSalesData = require('@/hooks/useSalesData').useSalesData
    mockUseSalesData.mockReturnValue({
      data: mockSalesData,
      loading: false,
      error: null
    })

    render(<SalesChart timeRange="daily" />)

    await waitFor(() => {
      expect(screen.getByText('Sales Performance - daily')).toBeInTheDocument()
    })
  })

  it('shows loading state', () => {
    const mockUseSalesData = require('@/hooks/useSalesData').useSalesData
    mockUseSalesData.mockReturnValue({
      data: null,
      loading: true,
      error: null
    })

    render(<SalesChart timeRange="daily" />)
    expect(screen.getByTestId('chart-skeleton')).toBeInTheDocument()
  })
})

import { createMocks } from 'node-mocks-http'
import handler from '@/pages/api/analytics/sales'
import { db } from '@/lib/database'

jest.mock('@/lib/database')

describe('/api/analytics/sales', () => {
  it('returns sales analytics data', async () => {
    const { req, res } = createMocks({
      method: 'GET',
      query: {
        timeRange: 'daily',
        startDate: '2024-01-01',
        endDate: '2024-01-31'
      }
    })

    // Mock database response
    const mockData = [
      { date: '2024-01-01', revenue: 1000, orders: 10 },
      { date: '2024-01-02', revenue: 1200, orders: 12 }
    ]
    
    ;(db.order.findMany as jest.Mock).mockResolvedValue(mockData)

    await handler(req, res)

    expect(res._getStatusCode()).toBe(200)
    const data = JSON.parse(res._getData())
    expect(data.success).toBe(true)
    expect(data.data).toBeDefined()
  })
})

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-dockerfile",children:`# Dockerfile
FROM node:18-alpine AS deps
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci --only=production

FROM node:18-alpine AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY . .
COPY --from=deps /app/node_modules ./node_modules
RUN npm run build

FROM node:18-alpine AS runner
WORKDIR /app
ENV NODE_ENV production

RUN addgroup -g 1001 -S nodejs
RUN adduser -S nextjs -u 1001

COPY --from=builder /app/public ./public
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next ./.next
COPY --from=builder /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY --from=builder /app/package.json ./package.json

USER nextjs
EXPOSE 3000
CMD ["npm", "start"]
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-f42f8a3a-dab9-4a25-b846-73b1671c998d.mdx",lineNumber:544,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/benjaminwilliams/Personal_manager_test/drew-hub/content/projects/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-f42f8a3a-dab9-4a25-b846-73b1671c998d.mdx",lineNumber:544,columnNumber:1},this),`

export const metrics = {
  httpRequests: new prometheus.Counter({
    name: 'http_requests_total',
    help: 'Total number of HTTP requests',
    labelNames: ['method', 'route', 'status_code']
  }),
  
  analyticsQueries: new prometheus.Histogram({

    help: 'Duration of analytics queries',
    labelNames: ['query_type', 'store_id']
  }),
  
  dashboardViews: new prometheus.Counter({
    name: 'dashboard_views_total',
    help: 'Total number of dashboard views',
    labelNames: ['dashboard_type', 'user_id']
  })
}
